thread.title: Australian market set to open lower
thread.title_full: Australian market set to open lower

title: Australian market set to open lower
text:
Wed, Aug 12, 2015, 6:54 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 3 hrs 6 mins Australian market set to open lower AAP â€“ 3 minutes 52 seconds ago Recommend Print 
The Australian market looks set to open lower following falls on international markets after China unexpectedly devalued its currency. 
At 0645 AEST on Wednesday, the September share price index futures contract was down 32 points at 5,374. 
In local economic news, Reserve Bank of Australia deputy governor Philip Lowe is to deliver the Shann Memorial Lecture in Perth. 
The Australian Bureau of Statistics releases the wage price index for June quarter, while the Westpac/Melbourne Institute Survey of Consumer Sentiment is due out. 
In equities news, Commonwealth Bank, AGL Energy, Echo Entertainment, Carsales, CSL, REA Group, Dexus Property Group and Primary Health Care are slated to post full year results, while OZ Minerals is due to release half year results. 
The Australian share market on Tuesday closed lower, dragged down by healthcare stocks with Cochlear suffering a sharp selloff after its earnings dissapointed investors. 
The benchmark S&P/ASX200 index was down 36 points, or 0.65 per cent, at 5,473.2. 
The broader All Ordinaries index was down 31.8 points, or 0.58 per cent, at 5,473.1. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook
